items.sentence: Are you the girl Tom has been hanging out with?
I don\'t think you realize how much I miss you.
I haven\'t given Tom permission to do that yet.
Tom is going to rent a car and drive to Boston.
Tom is going to write a letter to Mary tonight.
Tom is in need of medical attention right away.
Tom is in the kitchen helping Mary cook dinner.
Tom is in the kitchen with Mary cooking dinner.
Tom said he didn\'t want to be alone with Mary.
Tom said he doesn\'t plan to stay here all day.
Tom told me that he thought Mary was beautiful.
Tom told me that his father was a teacher, too.
Tom told us where he spent his spring vacation.
Tom has the experience necessary to do the job.
Tom has three fingers missing on his left hand.
Tom looks as happy as any person could ever be.
Tom offered what he thought was helpful advice.
I heard that both Tom and Mary have been fired.
I hope next time will be better than last time.
I just thought of something else I have to buy.
I don\'t think Tom is going to want to do that.
Tom is becoming more like his mother every day.
I didn\'t know that Tom used to live in Boston.
There are many other things we should be doing.
Tom should do something regarding this problem.
Tom should never have borrowed money from Mary.
Tom should tell Mary that she ought to do that.
Tom showed Mary a wallet-size photo of his son.
Aren\'t you glad we\'re here instead of Boston?
We must make arrangements with them beforehand.
We need to find Tom and tell him what happened.
Where do you usually go when you have time off?
Tom couldn\'t wait to tell Mary the great news.
Do you think it\'ll be hard for Tom to do that?
Did you know that Tom is good at making coffee?
Did you not know that that was going to happen?
Are you saying Tom\'s hiding something from us?
Are you sure you don\'t remember what happened?
Are you sure you don\'t want me there with you?
Why didn\'t you answer the door when I knocked?
Why didn\'t you let me know you were in Boston?
Why didn\'t you tell me that you could do that?
It\'s become very hard for me to walk very far.
It\'s hard to believe that Tom is still single.
Tom must have spent a fortune on his new house.
Tom needs to be told not to do that by himself.
Tom needs to take a long, hard look at himself.
Tom needs to tell Mary what he wants her to do.
Tom never told his children that he loved them.
I\'m afraid we\'re going to be late for school.
